section.heading: Definition.
section.text: In this chapter, "certificate of origin" has the meaning stated in Transportation Article, §13-101, Annotated Code of Maryland.

para.text: The Manufacturer's Certificate of Origin for a new motor vehicle shall have the security features and be in the form recommended by the American Association of Motor Vehicle Administrators.

A distributor of motor vehicles, licensed under Transportation Article, Title 15, Annotated Code of Maryland, may issue the uniform certificate of origin on behalf of the manufacturer of a new motor vehicle.
The Manufacturer’s Certificate of Origin for trailers, with a gross vehicle weight of 3,000 pounds or less, may be exempt from the security features required in §A of this regulation.

section.heading: Return of Certificate of Origin.
section.text: The Administration may not return a certificate of origin unless the certificate of origin accompanies an application for title reflecting a vehicle different than the vehicle actually sold.

annotations.annotation: Transportation Article, §§12-104(b), 13-101, and 13-104.1(1), Annotated Code of Maryland
Chapter revised effective October 15, 2012 (39:20 Md. R. 1307)
